column4: trikkex ~ make sure that windows is installed first and on the first partition

windows does NOT like being put elsewhere. also make sure that your particular IDE controller is supported by windows. most are but you might have an offboard SATA it doesn't have a driver for or something

I tried to install windows before and after linux. I had windows installed and got a nasty virus (surprise surprise) and wiped out everything, but I accidently deleted all the partitions, so I'm guessing I killed the SATA drivers as well. How the F do I reinstall SATA drivers?
alright thanks alot, I'm gonna go give that a shot. Sorry for abusing the room ;)
